Steven Canoy

The Evolution Of Technology and Hybrid Digital Art

Image.Lorem, ispsum: Campus Saftey Magazine © artists retain copyright

The Evolution Of Technology and Hybrid Digital Art

Steven Canoy

yourwebsite.com

Abstract

A personal perspective on the advancements in technology and its impact on new media and hybrid digital art. It explores the beginning of the world wide web and the changes made to accelerate us into the future followed by the dark web and its negative impact on society. The possibilities of the world wide web opened multiple doors for artists to explore new media and create hybrid digital art. This article takes a look at some of the artwork that has been created with the technology at the time along with emerging hybrid digital art of from the present leading into the future.

Article Body

Steven Canoy

Art 104

Final Project Outline

Title: The Evolution of Technology and Hybrid Digital Art

Keywords: Hybrid Digital Art, Web 1.0, Web 2.0, Web 3.0, Nicholas Negraponte, Mark Abene, Nam June Paik, Cory Arcangel, Ofir Shoham, Hacker, Hacker Aesthetic, Glitch Art.

Disciplines: Interdisciplinary Arts and Media: Social and Behavioral Sciences: Communication Technology and New Media 

Introduction:

Hybrid digital art of today has advanced in ways to make photorealistic digital images where we can’t tell what is real or not. Photogrammetry is a great example of taking real life objects and digitizing them. The other possibility with the World Wide Web is crypto currency and the blockchain. Programs working together in a decentralized network. This was one of the optimistic predictions of Nicholas Negroponte, but there are also people who take advantage of technology and use it to commit fraud, steal information, etc. and the way information is used today is not the same as it was 10 years ago. Data has become vital to companies and advertisements. Facebook, Apple, Google, Amazon, TickTock, Instagram, etc all collect data on the things you “like'', watch, and click on their applications and are able to target a certain audience to broadcast information. It is continuously growing and the web seems to be forever changing. Our future of hybrid digital art is being sold as NFT’s or engaging in the Metaverse. It is still new to many but nonetheless it is here. 


  • World Wide Web

A. Web1.0 - 2.0

      1. Web 1.0 was all about reading and getting   information.

      2. What changed from 1.0 - 2.0? Web 2.0 was about reading, writing, and creating.

B. Web 3.0

      1. How did the internet evolve? Advancements in technology lead to an evolved data- driven Semantic Web employing a machine-based understanding of data with the objective of developing a more intelligent and connected web experience for users.

      2. AI technology: Siri or Alexa are great examples of web 3.0 because they have voice recognition software. 

  • Phiber Optik and the “Dark” Web

A. Mark Abene was an online hacker who spent most of his time on the dark web with his username as Phiber Optik.

      1. Hackers -  A hacker is someone who uses computers to gain unauthorized access to data. 

      2. Hacktivists emerged as a person who gains unauthorized access to computer files or networks in order to further social or political ends. (i.e. Anonymous)

      3. Technology evolved along with the dynamics of the world wide web which, in my opinion, opened more doors for artists to explore new media.

B. Online Culture

      1. How was the community growing around computers and technology back then? Has anything changed?

      2. Netart (i.e. jodi.org)

  • Advancements in Technology

A. Web 3.0

      1. Advanced security systems

      2. Social Media and Online shopping

  • Glitch Art and Hacker aesthetics

A. What is a Glitch

      1. Glitch Art

B. Cory Arcangel

      1. Super Mario Clouds

      2. Hacker aesthetic

Hybrid digital art then and now

A. Nam June Paik

      1. Phiber Optik

      2.More Log in Less Logging

B. Ofir Shoham

      1.Emerging hybrid digital art

      2. New digital software programs

Negroponte’s prediction of technology

A. What was predicted

      1. 5 predictions from 1984

B. What has been true and untrue

Video teleconferencing, service kiosk, touchscreens etc.

How information is used on the web Today

A. Data /  Information collection

      1. Facebook, Instagram, Google, Amazon

B. Database Art

Today’s future of technology

A. Facebook

      1. Metaverse

B. NFTs

      1. Open Sea

      2. Minting

Conclusion: If Facebook crashes with their Metaverse project, who will be the ones to inhabit that virtual world? Will China beat the U.S. with their new AR glasses that integrate the real world with digital art? As humans advance along with technology, so will hybrid digital art, but the future is here and still evolving.
